Verde Arregoitia format: revealjs: theme: curso_styles.scss chalkboard: true transition: fade progress: true multiplex: false preview-links: true hide-inactive-cursor: true highlight-style: pygments pause: true editor: source knitr: opts_chunk: dev: "ragg_png" retina: 3 dpi: 200 execute: freeze: auto cache: true echo: true --- ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_5da631697a7a83c75c8d871dd3ce96b5'} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` here() starts at /media/luisd/H/sync/Dropbox/darcyDB/PDRF/PCB-R-curso ``` ::: ::: ## Filogenias en R ¿árbol filogenético? . . . Diagrama que muestra la relación evolutiva/similitud entre especies (o taxones) ##
Uno de los formatos más utilizados para representar filogenias son el *Newick*(.tree)

El formato Newick es una notación para representar relaciones evolutivas utilizando paréntesis y comas. A y B se parecen más entre sí que a X ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/prueba newick_0b7466dc17dc69157abc3ca9caa44de8'} ```{.r .cell-code} "((A,B),X);" ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "((A,B),X);" ``` ::: ::: ## Para trabajar con esta notación, podemos usar `ape` (Analysis of Phylogenetics and Evolution): ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/newick_e9305c459dd9d8b795701c73bb65e060'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ape) read.tree(text="((A,B),X);") %>% plot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/newick-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## El formato Newick es anidado: Los lobos, coyotes y zorros pertenecen a Canidae; los lobos y coyotes (género _Canis_) están más estrechamente relacionados ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/canii_91eae2b27ef6b14c9c1de1072bcfc6b1'} ```{.r .cell-code} Canidae <-"(Vulpes_vulpes,(Canis_lupus,Canis_latrans));" read.tree(text=Canidae) %>% plot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/canii-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Si agregamos murciélagos, todos pertenecen a los mamíferos: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_97a9f2a353668c426826bcd5b80a0829'} ```{.r .cell-code} Mammalia <-"(Desmodus_rotundus,(Vulpes_vulpes,(Canis_lupus,Canis_latrans)));" read.tree(text=Mammalia) %>% plot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Si quisieramos agregar cuervos y zanates. ¿Éstos dónde irían? ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_1307184a33bb06356eb7c0d4eb6f55b1'} ```{.r .cell-code} tetrapoda<-"((Quiscalus_mexicanus,Corvus_corax),(Desmodus_rotundus,(Vulpes_vulpes,(Canis_lupus,Canis_latrans))));" read.tree(text=tetrapoda) %>% plot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Agregando una planta, los mamíferos y las aves se anidan ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/planta_d6c8a1206bf34e2acb0e1efea017a605'} ```{.r .cell-code} Eukarya<-"(Sideroxylon_celastrinum,((Quiscalus_mexicanus,Corvus_corax),(Desmodus_rotundus,(Vulpes_vulpes,(Canis_lupus,Canis_latrans)))));" Nktree<-read.tree(text=Eukarya) plot(Nktree) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/planta-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Graficando filogenias con `ggtree` `ggtree` nos permite graficar, personalizar, anotar árboles filogenéticos usando la gramática de gráficos ## Paquetes necesarios: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_e5f0a96ba3ae04e6b61b0165d45a8df1'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ape) library(ggtree) library(deeptime) library(tidytree) library(ggimage) ``` ::: ## Icteridae ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_b373d3285580db223519d13f440693a2'} ```{.r .cell-code} ictree <-read.tree(here("data","Icteridae_tree.txt")) ictree ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Phylogenetic tree with 100 tips and 99 internal nodes. Tip labels: Icterus_melanopsis, Icterus_northropi, Icterus_laudabilis, Icterus_dominicensis, Icterus_cayanensis, Icterus_pyrrhopterus, ... Node labels: 761, 762, 763, 764, 765, 766, ... Rooted; includes branch lengths. ``` ::: ::: ## Visualizando el objeto con `ape` ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_c68b69a0dc1052cb8127406209797180'} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(ictree, show.tip.label=F) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Con `ggtree` > Asignamos la figura al objeto `p1` ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_0a56635f9bc1a9cb14dc456b2fee9c2f'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1<-ggtree(ictree,color="black",size=0.5) p1 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## El argumento/función `layout` cambia la disposición del árbol: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_84244b79e7ecff313ff111be327f2894'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+layout_dendrogram()+ p1+layout_fan()+ p1+layout_circular() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Scale for y is already present. Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale. Scale for y is already present. Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale. Scale for y is already present. Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Cambiar el color del fondo: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_23449c3895d83235b0f9afffcd926727'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ theme_tree(bgcolor="lightblue") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Agregar las etiquetas de las puntas: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_4ceb6821a241aa8df751b5754e5d7f23'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_tiplab(size=1,color="darkblue",angle=10) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Formas en cada punta ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_5e74ed0f3e7ca70e713f119bb48a5640'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_tippoint(size=1,color="brown",shape=10) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Rotular nodos: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_c0c0610c9312488230a949cafe7177cb'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_nodelab(size=1,color="purple") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Puntos en cada nodo: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_07795ad4558a46ff36837453d0a66099'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_nodepoint(size=2,color="red",shape=16) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## A gregar una escala temporal a la filogenia, con el paquete `deeptime` ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_fa621aff25f19d712bc18434088f4e45'} ```{.r .cell-code} py<-revts(p1) py+coord_geo(xlim=c(-10,-1),abbrv = F,neg=T,skip=NULL,dat="stage",size=1.5)+ theme_tree2() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Combinando `geoms` ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_220daa92e6d9bbadfc3a63bb18a1b4a4'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ layout_dendrogram()+ theme_tree(bgcolor="#e9f0ea")+ geom_tiplab(size=0.5,color="darkblue",angle=45)+ geom_tippoint(size=1,color="brown",shape=10)+ geom_nodelab(size=1,color="purple")+ geom_nodepoint(size=2,color="red",alpha=0.3,shape=16) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Anotaciones > ej: destacar el género *Quiscalus* - encontrar el nodo del ancestro en común más reciente - crear un *tibble* con la información del árbol - buscar las especies de *Quiscalus*: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_2eaabe8ae38139e0bce6d3c14ff99b1f'} ```{.r .cell-code} ictree %>% as_tibble %>% filter(grepl("Quiscalus",label)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 4 parent node branch.length label 1 146 41 1.82 Quiscalus_quiscula 2 148 42 0.851 Quiscalus_niger 3 149 43 0.335 Quiscalus_major 4 149 44 0.335 Quiscalus_mexicanus 5 150 45 1.02 Quiscalus_nicaraguensis 6 150 46 1.02 Quiscalus_lugubris ``` ::: ::: ## Ancestro común más reciente (`MRCA()`) de las dos especies en el género con la longitud de rama más larga y más corta ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_079ace0b029f6e128387d6fd786adf5b'} ```{.r .cell-code} ictree %>% as_tibble %>% MRCA(41,43) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 4 parent node branch.length label 1 144 146 1.37 806 ``` ::: ::: . . . ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-19_f3e44d725a38ad931b097fa12e8eda15'} ```{.r .cell-code} ictree %>% as_tibble %>% MRCA("Quiscalus_quiscula","Quiscalus_mexicanus") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 4 parent node branch.length label 1 144 146 1.37 806 ``` ::: ::: ## Anotar el género *Quiscalus* en la filogenia utilizando `geom_cladelab` (nodo 146) ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-20_879048b09e0f868ea757cf2fa356dd70'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_cladelab(node=146,label = "Quiscalus",offset=0, barcolor="red",textcolor="brown", angle=-90, offset.text=0.1,hjust=0.5) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Destacar el género*Icterus*: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-21_f732f6e5a26fc6391b9dfb3ee62bf8f3'} ```{.r .cell-code} ictree %>% as_tibble %>% filter(grepl("Icterus",label)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 31 × 4 parent node branch.length label 1 111 1 0.193 Icterus_melanopsis 2 111 2 0.193 Icterus_northropi 3 114 3 1.47 Icterus_laudabilis 4 114 4 1.47 Icterus_dominicensis 5 116 5 0.197 Icterus_cayanensis 6 116 6 0.197 Icterus_pyrrhopterus 7 115 7 0.943 Icterus_auricapillus 8 117 8 1.49 Icterus_bonana 9 117 9 1.49 Icterus_portoricensis 10 118 10 2.24 Icterus_prosthemelas # ℹ 21 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-22_40f34a6d2a70748dccf0598b8372870a'} ```{.r .cell-code} ictree %>% as_tibble %>% MRCA(25,14) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 4 parent node branch.length label 1 103 104 2.92 764 ``` ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-23_d0476a6b9438ebc5635c3bae4d43bd8a'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+xlim(0,11)+ geom_cladelab(node=104,label="Icterus",geom="label", fill="yellow",textcolor="red", barcolor="gray",angle=90,size=19) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## `geom_strip()` para dibujar líneas entre dos puntas arbitrarias ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-24_3f184e7a6c456fc8e7e0d6ccd345232c'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+xlim(0,15)+ geom_strip("Quiscalus_quiscula","Icterus_icterus", label=" un clado polifilético", barsize = 2, offset.text = 0.2,size=15) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## `geom_highlight` para destacar clados sobre las mismas ramas: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-25_d91f3e7496ce41d78e0582f37df64c1d'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_highlight(node=146,alpha=0.5,fill="purple",type = "rect") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-25-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## highlight + rótulo ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-26_ffca57cdef45d8839335bf8dcc90cb92'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_highlight(node=146,alpha=0.5,fill="purple",type = "rect")+ geom_cladelab(node=146,label = "Quiscalus",offset=0,barcolor="#9418f2",textcolor="#4c0980", offset.text=0)+ xlim(0,11.5) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## ### Enriquecer figuras con imágenes - siluetas desde [phylopic](https://www.phylopic.org/) o imagenes propias. - Es necesario cargar `rsvg` primero ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-27_c22c8bfc89eecd95930fecad4e92b172'} ```{.r .cell-code} library("rsvg") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Linking to librsvg 2.48.9 ``` ::: ::: ### Requisitos - tabla con nodos, especies o clados a anotar, y el identificador de los mismos en Phylopic (_phylopic_id_) ## *Quiscalus* y *Agelaius* tienen imagenes indexadas en *phylopic* Encontrar los identificadores con `phylopic_uid()` ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-28_3696891c2c5e80df620f5076d0895ad8'} ```{.r .cell-code} ids<-phylopic_uid(c("Quiscalus","Agelaius")) ids ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` name uid Quiscalus Quiscalus 2ada4e2f-35ab-48d2-b32e-3bad57033dd4 Agelaius Agelaius 2a48d7c6-5e9d-4d71-9291-ff4c68643cdf ``` ::: ::: ## Tabla con los datos necesarios para anotar nuestra filogenia: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-29_5db6a5d4c3451fe58d49487d8725c0d5'} ```{.r .cell-code} dt<-data.frame(node=c(146,136),image=ids$uid,genus=c("Quiscalus","Agelaius")) dt ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` node image genus 1 146 2ada4e2f-35ab-48d2-b32e-3bad57033dd4 Quiscalus 2 136 2a48d7c6-5e9d-4d71-9291-ff4c68643cdf Agelaius ``` ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-30_55ab04d391a23b1470db595fe8c9f373'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_cladelab(data = dt, mapping = aes(node = node, label = genus, image = image, color = genus), geom = "phylopic", offset = 0, offset.text=0.5) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-30-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Cambiando los colores de las figuras siguiendo gramática de gráficos: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-31_fba276e7e7304629d06625e790522209'} ```{.r .cell-code} p1+ geom_cladelab(data = dt, mapping = aes(node = node, label = genus, image = image, color = genus), geom = "phylopic", offset = 0, offset.text=0.5)+ scale_color_manual(values=c("#f75419","purple")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-31-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Más `geoms` ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-32_da1681385d39bf2573ff084c6d49bd8e'} ```{.r .cell-code} pr<-p1+ geom_cladelab(data = dt, mapping = aes(node = node, label = genus, image = image, color = genus), geom = "phylopic", offset = 0, offset.text=0.5)+ scale_color_manual(values=c("#f75419","purple"))+ geom_highlight(node=146,alpha=0.5,fill="purple",type = "rect")+ geom_highlight(node=136,alpha=0.5,fill="#f75419",type = "rect") pr ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-32-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Ejemplo con múltiples anotaciones por Axel Arango: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-33_276e78f5206e87188e0fade8becc643c'} ::: ## ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-34_8ebf7f161d40cec363a4b3ec1e1adc65'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-34-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Graficando atributos de las especies en la filogenia. Cargar los atributos, en este caso Hand Wing Index (HWI) y el hábito migratorio: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-35_79f3668f8fe3eb7ace12ef8e1f7a2fe4'} ```{.r .cell-code} hwi<-read.csv(here("data","hwi_icteridae.csv"),header=T) head(hwi) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` X HWI 1 Icterus_melanopsis 26.51912 2 Icterus_northropi 21.02135 3 Icterus_laudabilis 22.22500 4 Icterus_dominicensis 26.52877 5 Icterus_cayanensis 26.26213 6 Icterus_pyrrhopterus 17.75463 ``` ::: ::: ## ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-36_5bc46e91fd087038db6ffafd8f88d698'} ```{.r .cell-code} migrants<-read.csv(here("data","icterimigrants.csv"),header=T) head(migrants) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` sp migratory 1 Agelaioides_badius No-migrant 2 Agelaius_assimilis No-migrant 3 Agelaius_humeralis No-migrant 4 Agelaius_phoeniceus Migrant 5 Agelaius_tricolor No-migrant 6 Agelaius_xanthomus No-migrant ``` ::: ::: ## Unienr con la filogenia (es importante que las especies estén rotuladas como label) ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-37_a9aa0b47ed2bf14b5381631001b721f3'} ```{.r .cell-code} names(hwi)<-c("label","hwi") names(migrants)<-c("label","migratory") hwimigrants<-hwi%>% left_join(migrants,by="label") datatree<-full_join(ictree,hwimigrants,by="label") datatree ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 'treedata' S4 object'. ...@ phylo: Phylogenetic tree with 100 tips and 99 internal nodes. Tip labels: Icterus_melanopsis, Icterus_northropi, Icterus_laudabilis, Icterus_dominicensis, Icterus_cayanensis, Icterus_pyrrhopterus, ... Node labels: 761, 762, 763, 764, 765, 766, ... Rooted; includes branch lengths. with the following features available: '', 'hwi', 'migratory'. # The associated data tibble abstraction: 199 × 5 # The 'node', 'label' and 'isTip' are from the phylo tree. node label isTip hwi migratory 1 1 Icterus_melanopsis TRUE 26.5 No-migrant 2 2 Icterus_northropi TRUE 21.0 No-migrant 3 3 Icterus_laudabilis TRUE 22.2 No-migrant 4 4 Icterus_dominicensis TRUE 26.5 No-migrant 5 5 Icterus_cayanensis TRUE 26.3 No-migrant 6 6 Icterus_pyrrhopterus TRUE 17.8 No-migrant 7 7 Icterus_auricapillus TRUE 17.3 No-migrant 8 8 Icterus_bonana TRUE 16.9 No-migrant 9 9 Icterus_portoricensis TRUE 22.3 No-migrant 10 10 Icterus_prosthemelas TRUE 24.1 No-migrant # ℹ 189 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## Filogenia con atributos - Valores continuos del HWI sobre las puntas del árbol en una escala de colores: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-38_85c2ac7e97f7d6de743734b51e1f0748'} ```{.r .cell-code} p5<-ggtree(datatree) p5+ geom_tippoint(aes(color=hwi)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-38-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## podemos también personalizar esta escala: ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-39_d312209c31e8979ef26b330ce1278aa4'} ```{.r .cell-code} p5+ geom_tippoint(aes(color=hwi),shape=15)+ scale_colour_gradient(low='blue', high='red',breaks= c(15,20,25,30,35)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-39-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Datos binarios ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-40_07bd4e4f5f881f4f3e8c9e34ebc2c2fb'} ```{.r .cell-code} p5+ geom_tippoint(aes(color=migratory),shape=15)+ scale_colour_manual(values = c("green","orange")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-40-1.png){width=1400} ::: ::: ## Combinando atributos ::: {.cell hash='04_filogenias_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-41_e076cd7c8dbd5b5309105f609e51c1c0'} ```{.r .cell-code} px<- py%<+% migrants + geom_tippoint(aes(color=migratory),shape=15)+ scale_color_manual(values = c("#961d29","#1420a3"))+ scale_fill_manual(values = c("#961d29","#1420a3")) px+ geom_facet(panel="HWI",data = hwi,geom=geom_col,mapping=aes(x=hwi,color=migratory,fill=migratory),orientation='y')+ theme_tree2() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_filogenias_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-41-1.png){width=1400} ::: :::
